creator: mary.bednar7g
title: Arduino Laser Wand
materials_required: Laser (6 wires) or laser pointer (4 wires)
description: This project involves creating a laser wand using an Arduino, a laser, and some basic electronic components. The wand's behavior is controlled by a photoresistor, which triggers an LED or buzzer when exposed to light.
steps: Strip the USB cable: Cut off the non-USB end of the cable and carefully strip the black wire to expose four smaller wires inside. Strip the ends of the red and black wires.
Solder the laser to some male to male wires and then solder that to the USB cable that you stripped the wire off of
Cut the straw in half lengthwise to create a rectangle.
Cut the straw width-wise into a two-thirds piece and a one-third piece.
Fold the smaller piece in half to create a triangle to hold the wires.
Put the laser in the longer straw piece and tape it.
Add glitter, glitter glue, or a pipe cleaner for decoration.

Set up the breadboard: Plug one leg of the photoresistor to analog input 0 and the other to 5 volts. Plug one leg of the resistor to analog input 0 and the other to ground. Attach an LED or buzzer to digital pin 13.
Upload the provided code to the Arduino, adjusting the value 750 if necessary, for your particular laser.
